website_summaries.verdict: A sound investment that will add numerous food prep options to your kitchen.
pros: Features rugged stainless steel construction with removable nonstick cooking plates
cons: There are less costly models on the market, but few offer such versatility

website_summaries.verdict: You'll spend a bit more for this grill, but if you want a multi-function unit that doesn't seem to have a weak spot, this unit is worth the cost.
pros: Garners praise for its floating cover, which adjusts to adequately cook food of various thickness and ensures even heat distribution
cons: A handful of consumers warn that excess grease and oil can drip onto the countertop if the lid isn't opened evenly

website_summaries.verdict: A multi-functional panini press from a popular maker that has much to offer.
pros: can be used in the open position for numerous grilled creations
cons: A few reports of quality concerns, including uneven heat and poor hinges

customer_reviews.title: Not enough heat. Defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: Cooked pancakes and the Griddler does not get up to correct Temps. Lower plate peaked at 313F, upper plate at 253F. Not hot enough to brown pancakes. Have had difficulty getting a replacement, being directed to the wrong people, needing info on the unit while I was at work etc. I love the design and if we get a unit that works as advertised I would be delighted to keep and recommend it. Photo detail: green preheat light on when set to 425. Instant read thermometer may not be perfectly accurate, but when pancakes are completely dried on top and won't brown the heat is obviously too low.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked amazing for about 7 months now top half won't lock in place
customer_reviews.text: Man I want to love this thing, it has cooked amazing the last 7 months but sadly now the top half which can lock in place doesn't. So it just dangles there and since it also gets hot you have to be careful cause it stick out more since it doesn't lock. Shame cause it really does a good job. I was using it twice a week for reference and almost never used it to press but just liked grilling on the bottom half so I don't squeeze the juices out.
customer_reviews.author: Tokyo90s

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made. Waste of $$
customer_reviews.text: This is very poorly made. Leaks grease everywhere. Ones side is always sloped so you cannot make eggs like it shows. The grates do not fit perfectly together and parts of the metal were deformed. The corners do not fit right. The way the grease is made to slide into the grease drain does not work if you are using both sides. A lot falls through the cracks if you open and close it. We tried burgers and grease leaked under the grate plates and it was a disaster!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Ruined our gift exchange Christmas morning :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present but instead of Joy, I was horrified, when I realized it wasn't new. There was old dried food on the inside of the griddle. Just WOW. Nasty! I don't even know how well the product would have worked but evidently someone wasn't pleased because they sent it back after cooking on it first and didn't bother to clean it! I wish I knew how I ended up with it. I know Christmas is a busy time for everyone but really! Of course I was refunded but you can't get back the moment. It was the only gift my Husband had to open!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: msticwriter

customer_reviews.title: To brown pancakes and waffles you have to turn up to 425degrees and wait a good 10 minutes or more to heat up
customer_reviews.text: This is our 3rd Cuisinart Griddler GR-4N 5-in-1. First two lasted until they would not hear. Ordered 3rd one and would not get hot enough to do pancakes and waffles. Ordered replacement but does not seem to be much different. To brown pancakes and waffles you have to turn up to 425degrees and wait a good 10 minutes or more to heat up. The first two seemed to be better made than these last ones. Am trying it out still and hope it will be ok.Also top lid is a little hard to control opposed to first two. We have enjoyed this machine going on 5 years from the first we received as a gift. Hope this helps with product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like it but have 2 small issues.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Griddler and would give it 5 stars if you could flip the plates over for a lined pattern like many Panini grills have. It heats up great, with even browning over the sandwich. There is one other issue. After heating, if you have a thick sandwich, you have to touch the hot lid to release it's hinge so it will lay flat instead of on an angle. This is a little dangerous, you need a pot holder, Look at the product photo and you can see the lid is normally angled but it has a release lever so it can move and float on its axles. But it's stiff, maybe over time, it will loosen.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D

customer_reviews.title: Small, slow to warm up, easy to clean, good budget purchase, good quality
customer_reviews.text: For my purpose, this works well. It is small, it takes a little while to warm up the plates, but once it warms up, it works great. Honestly, I have only done bagels, sandwiches, and warmed up leftover pizza with this unit. I wrap the pizza in aluminum foil and place ti between the plates, it is quicker than the oven, I hate microwaved pizza, so this works very well for me, but it will only fit three slices. It is easy to clean, with removable non stick plates. It is very affordable and makes good paninis, overall it is a good quality product for a small household. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: rayros215

customer_reviews.title: Very nice griddle/press
customer_reviews.text: We've had this sandwich press/griddle combo for several months and have used both configurations. This is a great little appliance. Actually, it's not so little. It easily fits several pieces of meat or several sandwiches in the press format, and the double griddle is very nice for pancakes or sausage. Heat is very evenly distributed and it heats up quickly. Super easy to clean because you just pop the plates off. The handle is nice, too. Our last two sandwich presses just had a little notch you lifted. Easy to burn yourself! We're very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but very uneven
customer_reviews.text: This griddler works pretty well. The plates are easy to remove and clean and the interface is easy to use. I'm finding it a bit low powered, having to cook most everything on high or sear. But it gets the job done. One thing that I'm less pleased with is the distribution of heat. The heat is spotty on each side and the bottom is far and away more powerful than the top. Like the bottom can burn before the top starts getting colour, which is very unfortunate. I'm having to flip things over to get them cooked evenly, which kind of defeats the purpose of a griddler. If that was fixed this would be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jazlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for Oil-Free Grilled Vegetables
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this unit almost daily since it arrived. I love it for grilled veggies; straight from the freezer onto the griddle, no thawing or oil required. I also used it this week for perfect hash browns, again with no oil. I love it for making grilled sandwiches; the floating hinge lid means one side of the sandwich does not get squashed. Just wipe down the still hot cooking surfaces with a tong-held wet paper towel and cleanup is a snap. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: KarenWho

customer_reviews.title: No grease drainage
customer_reviews.text: It does not drain the grease away from the food! My steak sauted in grease that did not drain, actually the collection tray for the grease was absolutely spotless. Grill marks on 1 side of steak only and they were nothing to brag about. I am returning as I bought based on the reviews and the grill did not live up to the reviews. It is nice looking but it does not grill properly so I was not satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Wowly

customer_reviews.title: Return Buyer
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second one of these. We've been using the first one for months and love it so much I bought this second one as a gift. The plates are super easy to clean and are dishwasher safe, which can be a real timesaver! It heats up fast and has much versatility. For best results, use leaner meats of uniform thickness. 70/30 burgers cooked great, but there was SO much fat that it couldn't channel into the grease catcher fast enough and splattered the counter a good deal. If you're trying to cook meat with uneven thickness, you will get unevenly cooked meat.
customer_reviews.author: Jorja229

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a BEAST
customer_reviews.text: I purhased the GR-4N about a week ago. Started using it before I even read the manual. Set up was quite simple. My first meal on it was whitefish patties and veggies. Came out perfectly brown not burned in under 6 minutes frozen. I set the selector to grill and medium high. Since then I have cooked burgers, golden crisp sub sandwiches, tater tots fish sticks, french toast. I may never use my range again. If I was young and still in college this would be the holy grail.
customer_reviews.author: Nitrixx

customer_reviews.title: An excellent grill, much better than Foreman
customer_reviews.text: I really love this grill. It's so much easier to clean, and heats more evenly than my old Foreman grill. My last Foreman was a newer model, and the ceramic coating didn't last 3 months. I received a replacement, and the same thing happened. I decided to try the Cuisinart "Griddler", and I couldn't be happier. I've learned to adjust cooking times, compared to the suggestions in the book, because what I'm cooking is not always what they describe. That, however, is the only adjustment I've had to make. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Acur81

customer_reviews.title: I am LOVING this thing
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I've only had it 4 days, but I have used it 3 times, and it is slick as can be. I used for a turkey burger. For Hot Italian turkey brats. And for a grilled ham & cheese. All 3 were excellent. I will cook the burger for slightly longer at a slightly lower temp going forward, but this was the first time. The brats I could for 11 mins at 325 - perfect. The grilled cheese took about 3 minutes due to heat from both sides. Truly wish I'd bought it sooner. And I didn't realize the plates are two-sided: Can be used for grill or griddle. And the clean-up very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: kt1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t heat properly!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Christmas gift and it doesn’t heat properly. So now it’s too late to return! What a waste of $100+ because of course I bought the extra items to go with it. Don’t waste your money! Cuisinart is supposed to be a great product. Very disappointed 😡 UPDATE: My son contacted Amazon and is getting to return the items since they were a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: raspada4

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for $39.
customer_reviews.text: I think you usually get what you pay for, but not in this case. This should be a $39 item, and I’d give it another star. But that’s it. It’s messy and drips grease despite the drip tray. It’s underpowered when doing more than one burger. Worst of all is the grease gets under the thin hot plates into where the heat coil is and good luck trying to get it out. As a result of all this, the thing smokes like crazy so have an outside exhaust or extra smoke detector batteries. I’d try more money and better design next time rather than once good name. IMHO
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: W0W!
customer_reviews.text: I live where I have not been able to grill for the last 13 years and I've missed it. No more. The Griddler is truly amazing. First, I am not a cook, even at 73 years old. Today I grilled and seared chicken breast. Tonight I had delicious grilled chicken for dinner and my cats are now in nirvana. Clean-up was just as Cuisinart says. I had the plates cleaned in a matter of minutes. (I don't mean dinner plates) I'm really excited about the prospects of cooking with the Cuisinart Griddler. The sky's the limit. This is one small appliance you won't see at a yard sale. Thanks Cuisinart. I recommend it completely.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Well built and the plates are easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit and it seems to be solid and well made. Plates are a breeze to remove and replace and the Teflon on them is definitely non-stick. Burnt cheese just wipes right off with a paper towel! Unit has a release latch so that it can be laid flat and used as a grill. Cord is a bit short for my tastes but that could just be me. Purchased the optional waffle plates for the unit but have not had a chance to use them yet. Teflon surface on them appears just like the griddle plates. Nice compact footprint on the counter and I am discovering new ways to put it to use every day.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my small apartment
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of the Griddler (the first was in 2012). My son loved the first one so much I gave it to him for his first home alone. I found I really missed it more than I thought I would. I had it on my wish list and when I got a notification from Amazon of a decrease in the price I just couldn't wait. Works great for breakfast meals but also for grilling a steak for one since I now live in a small apartment without access to an outdoor grill!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Austin

customer_reviews.title: Removable plates?! Yes please!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new grill!! My big George Forman was loosing the coating off of it. I wanted a grill where I could remove the plates and wash them. Because it’s just not cool trying to clean a grill off that doesn’t have removable plates. Like how is that even suppose to work!? This grill is the perfect solution. It’s a win win! You can make it fold flat which is super awesome! I’ve cooked pancakes, hamburgers, and tortillas so far and haven’t had any issues with it. I also got the plates where I can make waffles. Haven’t used those yet though.
customer_reviews.author: bubblekisses

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than a year ago. I don't use it a lot, so store it in my pantry. I took it out of the pantry, and bumped it against the wooden door jamb. One plastic leg on the back of the griddle tore off. Small appliances should survive one small bump without breaking to pieces. I'd gladly pay a couple extra dollars for sturdier construction. Now I'll spend the next several years trying to keep the thing level. It worked well while it lasted, although I only use it for steaks and chops. My previous grills, a Foreman and a Sunbeam, lasted about ten years each.
customer_reviews.author: Rory1959

customer_reviews.title: Quality  poor.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when I took it out of the box , the outer part of it was grease spattered. and the cord was poorly re-folded and wraped with a thin ordenary rubber- band. I feel I was sent a reconditioned one and not a new never used one, that I ordere . also it dose not remove very much of the fat from the meats as the table top grill I was replacing , and the drain off of the fat that is removed DOSEN'T DRAIN AWAY' there for the five stars for easy cleaning; this grills only good feature.. I will soon be giveing this one away and purchaseing the old brand that I had before....
customer_reviews.author: ROXIE A.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess!! Hard to clean up after.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time for cooking hamburgers. The sides of the grill plates are too short! The hamburger grease flowed over the tiny lip around the grill plates. A quarter inch higher on the sides would greatly improve this appliance. Cleanup was a hassle as well, due to all the nooks and crannies that grease gets into. The removeable plates are a nice feature. The "stainless steel" top is easily scratched. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry V.

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love this griddle pannini waffle combo
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this press for something like 6+ years and just decided to order a new one since my old one was looking well worn. Really love the ease of this appliance, especially cleaning up, the plates slide into the dishwasher and you can wipe down the outside. grease tray can be thrown in dishwasher too. I use this daily for breakfast, and occasionally for lunch or dinner. You can lay the plates flat, which is super convenient because you then have two cooking surfaces. do yourself a favor and buy the additional waffle plates.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Oakheart

customer_reviews.title: I Wanted This Griddler To Be Great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grill for awhile and end up avoiding it because it just doesn't get the job done efficiently. My biggest gripe is that grease (or any cooking liquids that show up) puddle on the grill and even occasionally run over the side. There's just not enough of an angle for the grease to reliably run into the little drain hole. Anyway ..., long and short, is that I'm going to sell this bad boy and get something else. I'm done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Razzierb

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted, but non-stick plates are not high quality and do not last
customer_reviews.text: What attracted me to this machine were the removable plates, to make the grill surface easy to wash. The problem is that the quality of the plates is not high - they gradually started sticking about three years after the purchase. Since Cuisinart's warranty is three years, they won't offer a replacement, and each plate costs $50 - it's cheaper to buy a new unit! It's a complete ripoff. It's especially disappointing because a much cheaper Foreman grill I once owned never had this problem, and while it was not easy to clean, the surface remained non-stick for many years. Not a unit I would recommend purchasing, and Cuisinart has lost a lot of trust from me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product!! Use it everyday.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We've use it everyday! I will admit I've purchased counter top grills before and before you know it, it's stored in a cabinet and somewhat forgotten. We started using this product when it arrived about 2 months ago and we've literally used it everyday. We've used it for both fresh and frozen meats, sandwiches, and the most prefect pancakes and bacon imaginable. The 3 cooking dials allows for a variety of temperatures ranging from 200 to 425 as well as high, med, low, warm and sear settings. The grill plates snap on and off easily and clean up is even easier whether hand wash or in the dishwasher. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: De'Andrea Y. Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Best value in price range
customer_reviews.text: Best grill in this price range. Heats quickly and evenly. Easy to use & easy to clean. Non-stick plates easily remove for cleaning. But I wish the heat controls listed temperatures instead of labeled medium or high. (What temp is “medium”?) I overcooked my burger last night!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm now a professional chef! I cooked chicken breast in 8 mns, perfect. Grilled sliders in 6 mns amazing. Cleaning this is so easy. I was super skeptical about buying this. But, I'm really happy with the booklet instructions and ease of cleaning. It does what it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: moneypenny

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Griddler! Easy cooking for everything from chicken to steaks or, grilled sandwiches. I used the Griddler to also make paninis, waffles & pancakes. Makes the best bacon ever without grease splatters . Pretty great little small appliance to add to your kitchen. I Especially love the easy clean up with the removable plates. Separate grease catchers are not required since the new design makes the grease-catching unit integral to the grill. Please click below vote if you found my review helpful so I can improve them to help others like you.
customer_reviews.author: Jor El

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Beats The Foreman grill by about ten miles. This is the most commonly used appliance, by far, in my kitchen. From paninis, to burgers, to steak, fish, and everything In between including pancakes. this thing does it all. The drip tray is new and improved. The griddle plates pop right off and go in the dishwasher. Easiest appliance to clean in my world. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. RobTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lack of good heat distribution
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this Panini Griddler as we have used and worn out two previous different brands. Thought I would try this one. Big mistake! It looks like it would work until I tried closing the lid on a nice loaded sandwich. It would push my sandwich out and since the top was so hot I would have to open the lid and get a fork to push the sandwiches back into place. Also, the second or third time I used this as a Panini maker, the top would not brown so I would have to flip the sandwich to get the other side brown. This defeats the purpose of a Panini. Sorry, only three stars
customer_reviews.author: Greg Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting an indoor grill for quite awhile and did a lot of research before my purchase. I have not been disappointed! It is wonderful. My husband and I enjoy our steaks done medium with a pink center and my outdoor grilling skills are awful! With my Cuisinart Grill I get it right every time. I love the ability to use both plates for fixing different breakfast items. The grill is easy to clean, the plates snap in and out easily for cleaning and do well in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Top and bottom heat do not match settings....poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This unit does not match temperatures on top and bottom resulting in cooking inconsistencies. Cuisinart used to be very fine quality....not in my experience. This year I also had to return a new coffeemaker that leaked. I won't buy any of their products in the future
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Since I read the directions before trying it (unlike my husband) it was easy to understand the 3 control knobs and their functions. Heats rapidly. Pork chops came out perfectly, top and bottom equally grilled. Looking forward to making pancakes. On a whim bought the waffle plates for a future adventure. The Grill is relatively small and stores easily in my pantry. Clean up took under 5 minutes. I'm 100% happy.
customer_reviews.author: AdoptAnOrphanDog

customer_reviews.title: Superb grill.
customer_reviews.text: Heats evenly, quickly. Cooks steaks to perfection. Very easy to remove and clean the Non-Stick plates for cleaning, with a little hot water, and soap, plates look like new again, ready for next use. Would recommend for anyone that wants to grill on your counter instead of outside with the bugs!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Really Great
customer_reviews.text: We are empty nesters, and going to bbq well, ..... MY husband did not like to bbq for just us. So I bought this Cusinart grill for him. He really likes this grill. Everything works great. The steaks taste like they were on the grill, hamburgers are TERRIFIC. He made pancake with chocolate chips they were fabulous. The clean up is easy. I would recommend this grill. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gussy

customer_reviews.title: Lousy panini and messy!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t make a decent panini on it to save me soul. Had a breville and loved it but was disappointed when it died in 2 years and it was not covered by a warranty so went with the cuisinart. Hate it!! It melts the cheese but doesn’t toast the bread!! Last night it took 35 mins to make 3 paninis that were lousy! How hard can it be to make a grilled cheese! I could have done it in a pan and not squished the bread!! So disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda K

customer_reviews.title: perfect for bacon
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this sooner. I purchased one of these a few years ago for my daughter who was starting grad school and she used it extensively. I finally decided to give it a try because I got a hankering for fresh panini sandwiches and this is exactly the appliance for that and many other uses. It cleans up faster than a skillet. I have used it for large hamburger patties and just made a breakfast with it... perfect for bacon. Recommend egg rings because there is a slight slope for draining grease. Not suggested for cooking bone-in meats such as pork chop but just about anything boneless is fair game.
customer_reviews.author: D. Downs

customer_reviews.title: Just what my kitchen needed
customer_reviews.text: All I was really looking for was a grill with removable plates for easy cleaning. I got that and more. It’s a breakfast griddle too and I went ahead and bought the accessory waffle plates. Looking forward to getting a lot of use out of my “Griddler.” I like it so much I eventually bought a Cuisinart toaster oven/air fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Butts

customer_reviews.title: Great griddle.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has cooked everything amazingly, even thick steaks, cooks sausages really fast, makes excellent pancakes, and grilled cheese sandwiches are a snap, cleanup is a no brainier with the pop out trays just put then in the dishwasher. Don't know why I didn't buy one of these sooner. The only drawback I can find is the drip tray, it's not very large so you have to monitor it closely if your cooking something like bacon or other things with a lot of drippings, but that wouldn't stop me from buying another one if the need should arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Tennisshoes

customer_reviews.title: Did not heat properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this griddler mostly to use an inside grill for chicken, steaks, shrimp, etc. I like grilled food but the outside grill is just too much work and mess for one person. The first time I used this I made homemade Naan bread. It sat on the open grill plates for over 20 minutes on HIGH and barely got cooked. I ended up transferring it to a grill pan on the stove which worked just fine. Perhaps mine was defective, bu this guy is going back.....
customer_reviews.author: Olivia in Napa

customer_reviews.title: The interchangeable plates are great and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The interchangeable plates are great and easy to clean. I use it to cook like chick-fil-e weekly. As other reviewers indicated, the control can be combine and simplify. I tried the pancake and it seems to take long time to heat up and they are not even from one end to the other. The hamburger is decent. If you want convenient and multi purpose , this is for you but it is not comparing to grilling outdoor. You won't get as nice crusty look. Overall, it is not the best thing but it is convenient and it cooks decent food.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with so many options.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this panini maker. One of the best things is that I could make two large sandwiches at the same time. Clean up was fast and efficient with plates being easy to take off and put back on. Can’t wait to try veggies on the grill. If I need to update this review I will. Otherwise this purchase was so worth it. I threw away my old Hamilton beach and also a too small George foreman press. Only need one. This one!
customer_reviews.author: G-Lynn

customer_reviews.title: NO! Drips Grease from Top plate
customer_reviews.text: Its okay, except for hamburgers, or anything that generates much grease. When you open it up, all the grease and juice on the top runs down and drips on your counter and the electric cord. It forms little puddles on your counter and gets all over the feet and bottom if you aren't careful.
customer_reviews.author: nom de plum

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time that I’ve purchased this griddler. I bought the first one for my own home and we love it so much that we bought a second one as a gift for our son. He lives in an apartment and wanted something to cook burgers, hot dogs, etc. on that would be easy to clean and wouldn’t make a big mess. We both love how easy it is to use and clean. Neither one of us have had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: I love it soo much!
customer_reviews.text: I just can't stop coming out with ideas of what to make for my family! It heats up really quickly and is easy to clean (just two "plates" basically). Food looks elegant and and it's much healthier (to grill rather than cook or fry). It's sturdy and nicely designed comparing to other options out there. Could have been bigger, but it's not a major issue, as it grills food so fast, you can quickly make some more if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Marcin Osajda

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This griddle is perfect to take to the office, tailgating and is easy to store at home. It distributes heat quickly and evenly and cleaning it is a breeze. If you’re looking for something to accommodate a larger family I wouldn’t recommend this however we are s family of 5 and it’s perfect for pancakes and bacon on Sunday mornings. Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Ava Szlamas

customer_reviews.title: It doesnt really heat properly
customer_reviews.text: I had one for a year and was so sad when it stopped heating.. I figured i had a lemon.. I like Cusinart products so I decided to get another one.. This one only came with one grill plate and one griddle plate, my last one came with 2 of each so when you make a Pannini you get the grill marks on each side.. Plus this plate is thinner and cheaper quality. Very disappointed in the decline of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Fuller

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this for me as a gift. I thought it would sit on the shelf next to my bread maker, never to be seen again, but happily I was wrong! I've made quesadillas; they turned out great, and melted cheese that leaked out and burnt wiped right off. I've made waffles; they turned out great too; the only problem is my Cuisinart waffle maker now sits idle; this is better because it is easier to clean. We like it enough that we bought two more for our son in laws.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Grandpa loves it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's grandpa in California lost his wife in December. He is the sweetest man ever and mentioned he missed her cooking steaks for him. Welp I purchased this as a Father's day gift and he made his first steak and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: catherine howard

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Get Hot Enough
customer_reviews.text: Plates don't get hot enough with cooking pancakes. Pancakes don't get golden brown. They could have made an adjustment for moving the temperature scale one way or the other. For Paninis it works just fine. I like the removable plates. They are well made. Not very easy to store or transport. Its rather large and bulky.
customer_reviews.author: pl4

customer_reviews.title: Useful and great made product
customer_reviews.text: I use it almost every day and very satisfied with the product. Nice design, easy to clean and great temperature control. One noticeable minus - when you cook meet there is no enough heat and you have to cook it long time until the meet is getting dry. I didn’t drop stars because as far as I understand US 120V outlets just can’t provide enough power to heat it stronger. Probably that’s why electric stoves use special 240V sockets. This griddler fits great to cook breakfast (eggs, sausages, bacon). Toasts come out nice and crunchy. Excellent for grilled cheese sandwiches.
customer_reviews.author: Xcegs

customer_reviews.title: A must have in the home.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Amazing grill!!!. Clean Grill check,Burgers prepped check start grilling!!!! I used both sides of the griddle to cook this burger. This is my second and third time cooking and it cooks everything good from burgers to chicken.. Haven't tried Panini's although. What great is the temperature control and how high the temps may be.. I think 400 or something. Here are some picture cooking two burgers(non frozen). I like mine well done. Everything works well from grease tray to heating.. Make sure you cook on even surface!!! Pros: Almost everything!!! Cons: I have tough times cleaning the grill like really tough time. Also don't touch the top silver part that's hot too......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... had mine for 16 months and at first I loved it. I used it maybe once or twice ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 16 months and at first I loved it. I used it maybe once or twice a week and always hand cleaned it well after each and every use. It slowly began to fall apart. The top grill would lock into place so it would was hard to spray with Pam once heated. The button to pop out the griddle broke and last night the unit broke in two while I was cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Impressed
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I got this was to cook a vegan patty for my daughter. The patties are breaded and they take a long time to cook in a pan and they need such a high heat. With this grill I have been making chicken panini's, chicken sandwiches all over the place and it is really very easy. The drip tray is very conveniently out of the way but I can see that it could overflow if you are cooking something really juicy or if you just totally forget about the tray entirely.
customer_reviews.author: ZCS

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier to clean than my old GF grill that didn't have removable plates. Most of the time, a rinse under running water gets any gunk off. Only downside so far is that the temp controls are a little confusing as there is with temp markings and one with low-high markings - if both are on, which setting will grill go to? Does it matter which plate I use? etc. . I think one control with both markings would be easier. I'm tempted to get the waffle plates.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Earlier version worked fantastic. Top element off 50 degrees
customer_reviews.text: We have a prior version of this product and is a work horse. Needed another for larger groups. This unit is terrible. Using my heat gun, the top element is 50-60 degrees lower than than bottom. No panini, no quesodella . Wife won't use it. No info from Cuisinart on how to resolve . Poor design . Get the unit with different griddle and panini plates.
customer_reviews.author: Flybox

customer_reviews.title: Negative Reviews All Wet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing in spite of all the bad reviews I read, because Cuisinart has always been a good brand for me, and it was on sale at a righteous price. Well, guess what? The bad reviews are WRONG. This panini press heats up promptly, has NO trouble maintaining temperature, is EASY to operate, and clean-up is a breeze! I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Georgia Peach

customer_reviews.title: Super recommend
customer_reviews.text: It is almost three months. I did a search before to make sure I choose the right one. Not much budget. I super like it! Easy to use and clean. I bought wagyu to barbecue! Easy to switch the iron plate. Check the photo, super perfect for use at home. Barbecue mushroom is my favorite ! Juicy!
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Product
customer_reviews.text: This does it all and does it well. Intelligently designed, multi purpose...........one of the only grillers that you can actually take the grill plates off and clean. Cleans up in a breeze. Use hot water, dish soap and a non scratch pad. Great design - can leave on your counter (because you will use it all the time for everything) and looks great. People will think you have taste and style....... FUN FACT: Do not use Pam product on grill plates (or any non stick surface) it's actually not compatible with nonstick cookware - will ruin it...use a non aerosol oil mister (pump), OR brush oil on grill OR use oil on paper towel and coat surface.
customer_reviews.author: L.Brinker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Clean, Compact
customer_reviews.text: I grill chicken just about every week for lunches, so I wanted a small griddler that was easy to use. This one is perfect for what I need. It took me a minute to figure out when the griddle was at the right temperature, and it seems like the top grill gets hotter than the bottom. Overall, the chicken always comes out completely cooked and juicy. I love that the griddles come off the grill, it makes clean up so much easier. It's also compact and light, so storage is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Krissi

customer_reviews.title: Bad Temperature Control
customer_reviews.text: We have several Cuisinart products in our kitchen to include an older Griddler version that continues to work very well. Bought 2 of this new model with high expectation (one was to be a gift), The new model does not obtain or maintain cooking temperature. Just when items start cooking the griddle cools and does not reheat until almost cold. Took 35 minutes to cook 5 slices of bacon after 10 minutes warming time. The book says it is a great way to cook breakfast for 2 people or a large family. At the rate I experienced, some of my family would get breakfast close to lunch time. Returning both griddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd L.

customer_reviews.title: This sucks
customer_reviews.text: This griddle sucks. The the grooves of the grill plates do not properly line up with the oil drip pan. So the juices drip onto my counter instead of into the oil drip pan. We followed the instructions in the manual and tried every which way of arranging the grill, same result.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Has griddle and a panini switch
customer_reviews.text: So easy to clean, takes a little to heat up but that time is spent assembling sandwiches. No problems We love this and it’s not overwhelming large for countertop. Fits two nice size sandwiches at a time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooks evenly and clean ups a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this griddler. I’ve used it almost daily since I’ve received it. Breakfast/lunch and dinner. Even a few snacks in between. It cooks so fast and cleans up so easy it’s my go to every time my stomach grumbles now. There are also waffle plates that fit this perfectly but those you have to purchase separately, which I did. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Childress

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heating and does not sear well
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed that this product did not live up to its name. The unit seems to heat unevenly, but most disappointing is that it does not sear well. I mean that was the whole point of the product was to get a good sear on meat. If not too late, I will try to return for refund.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye George Foreman
customer_reviews.text: This beats George Foreman's grill by a mile! It does everything it should superbly. It heats up quickly and evenly, the plates come out for easy cleaning, and the stainless is handsome and durable. Chicken, pork, hamburgers, steak, sandwiches, bacon, eggs - well I don't need to ramble; it does it all. I put it easily away rather than clutter my counters. I have learned that it does spit a bit of fat droplets on the counter, So I use a paper towel or two. Tasty, healthy, fast, and reliable. If it boiled my broccoli too I'd give my pots to Goodwill. Get one - you'll love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to any Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I spent a long time deciding which panini press I wanted to get, searching reviews and product review sites. Eventually decided on this one and it’s awesome. I was a little wary thinking any appliance at this price point had the potential to be cheaply made. This is very sturdy, heats well and there’s enough versatility to make this purchase worth it. I find a lot of the time I’m cranking the heat past the recommended setting but it’s still very effective at grilling sandwiches or anything else. I’ve made perfect pancakes and French toast for the entire family all at once. Definitely a great investment I’m glad I pulled the trigger on.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I thought if I purchased a Cuisinart I would be getting a good product. But this appliance feels flimsy and cheap. The whole unit feels like tin and as flimsy as aluminum foil. The plates are very light weight. The dials have a lot of play to them so I'm never sure if I have the setting correct. It does not drain well even though it has a collection reservoir. The lid does not stay secure. Especially hazardous since it gets very hot. The whole appliance gets very hot...not just the plates. It is not worth the pricey amount I paid for it. Very disappointed in Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Love it but waffle plates should be included
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used the Griddler to make grilled cheese sandwiches and waffles (with the separately purchased waffle plates). It heats up quickly and is simple to use. The waffles turn out perfect every time. I learned that when using it for sandwiches, regular sandwich bread is too thin and squashes down too flat. My only complaint is that the waffle plates should be included with it. If they came with it I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: EFS

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this griddler for about a week, have cooked almost every meal on it. Only one that had an issue was trying to cook 4 burgers, they cooked great, but the fat drippings over filled the drip tray. Have now cooked: bacon, burgers, chicken breasts, chicken tenders, grilled cheese, ham and cheese... even grilled a PB&J sandwich! Burgers were better on a regular BBQ, but everything else is perfect on this griddler. Easy to clean, heats up quickly
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this griddle. Super easy to clean. Heats up fast. Cooks great. So much easier to clean than George Forman. You can flip sides. Grill Marks or non grill Marks. Lies flat for bacon and pancakes. Whoop Whoop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing as sandwich press and as griddle
customer_reviews.text: I researched sandwich grills extensively, and chose this Cuisinart model as the best value. A year later, I am sorely disappointed and will be donating this to a charity event. Sandwiches in the press were soggy rather than crisply toasted. Sandwiches on the griddle were not much better. Pancakes on the griddle were so-so. I had hoped that, with the waffle inserts, this would replace both my waffle iron and flat-top griddle. No such luck; off to the silent auction it goes!
customer_reviews.author: KEC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little indoor grill/griddle. Cooks very well and distributes the heat evenly. Also has a little drawer thing that you can pull out to empty the grease. I love that the top grill can angle with a press of the button bc it makes it VERY easy to toast buns or large burgers without crushing them to death lol. It's also REALLY easy to clean up after using. Definitely recommend if you're wanting a counter top griddle/grill as it does a GREAT job.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this mainly to make Panini Sandwiches and I found the Waffle plates (purchased separately). All fits awesome and we have used it for Waffles, Pancakes and Panini Sandwiches. It cleans very easy since all removable plates are dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jairo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love it! Makes great hot sandwiches. Watch out, though, it gets hot! Make your adjustments to the top lid for the height of the food BEFORE you heat it up!
customer_reviews.author: Susan O.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I know most people have more gadgets than they need for kitchen but I am SO HAPPY I made the investment with this Griddler. I sware I use it daily. Whether I am cooking hashbrowns (to perfection mind you), or smashing some veggies for a quick side dish to dinner. I even reheated a rice and bean burrito. And the clean up is a BREEZE. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: SunnyDee

customer_reviews.title: How great this product is for the price
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable, I read many reviews about folks that were tired of there George Forman grill. What honestly caught my eye was the drip pan on this verses the old style messy on on the George Forman grill so I was sold, to be completely honest this has so much more than that reversible plates easy cleaning and absolute true temperature settings. Do yourself buy this “WOW”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great griddle. No downside.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for two years and love it. It is very versatile and operates as described. It has a plate on the bottom and one on the top. One side of the plates is smooth and the other is scored. The scored side is great for cooking meat that tends to dry out during cooking. Smooth side is fantastic for grilled sandwiches. Super easy to clean. The non-stick plates just snap in and out and will fit in the sink. When cooking steak or hamburger it emits a little smoke for the first few minutes. We solved that by sitting it on the stove and turning on the exhaust fan. Particularly good for family of two.
customer_reviews.author: Pattypye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my boyfriend last Christmas. He uses it habitually for his sandwiches and says its his favorite gift ever lol <3 Great for that man in your life that doesn't "cook" but you still want them to eat healthy and make their own meals instead of eating frozen pizza! Lol I will be buying the other versions as he is obsessed with this. :) He says it works great and is easy to clean and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: fsdgsdfgsh

customer_reviews.title: A Great Panini Grill
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this grill. The plates are easy to change, easily washed in dishwasher or by hand, wonderful for grilled sandwiches, which is what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: NGS

customer_reviews.title: Clean easily but heat up slowly
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and well packaged. I generally enjoyed using it since it is very easy to clean and maintain. The results (i.e.: my paninis) were generally successful. However, it does take some time to heat up and some spots heated up much faster/higher than other spots (therefore, constant attention is needed).
customer_reviews.author: ycl32

customer_reviews.title: Great grill, can make anything from eggs to steak.
customer_reviews.text: My son lives in an apartment that does not have a stove. He has an outside grill, but in winter he needs something for inside. This was really great for him. It’s fairly easy to clean, and he can cook anything on it. He is 25, and he really likes it. It’s a great alternative if you don’t have a place to cook inside.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one appliance
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Food cooks fast and great! The removable plates are great and simple for clean up! Two things I had problem with were when making hamburgers, small burgers will get flattened. You have to make them big and thick. Also the manual suggests using the seer setting for burgers. In my opinion, Seer is way too hot and "overdid" my burgers on top of setting off my smoke alarms in the house with all the smoke. I will NOT use the seer setting again. ever. Don't forget to purchase the waffle plates if you like waffles - they are well worth it. This appliance replaces my waffle maker and my George Foreman grill.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this 3 times since it arrived...grilled pork chops, & hamburgers. Both browned well when top was lowered. Have to be careful not to overcook. Grilled cheese & tomato sandwiches oozed cheese onto the griddle...maybe less cheese and/or keeping the cover open would help. All in all, the grill performed as advertised, but be sure to read the instructions before using. Cleanup is a bit messy, but the removable grids make it easy, and food does not stick. Generally I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Bossom

customer_reviews.title: appears to be good quality
customer_reviews.text: Have cooked quite a few things. So far so good. Bacon is a no go. Easy to change plates and easy to hand wash. Figure teflon coating will last longer if not put in dishwasher. Someone posted that they raise the front 2 legs for better grease drainage, good idea. The drip pan should have had more rounded interior corners for better and easier cleaning. Minimum smoke.
customer_reviews.author: john c

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I’m enjoying this griddle. I have had several different types of these griddles. This one is my favorite because you can lay out full strips of bacon without cutting them to fit. Also this griddle will fully open without the handle hitting my upper cabinet. No more turning sideways or pulling to very edge. The cooking surface seems to be evenly distributed, no hot spot found. The only thing I would change is the drip tray. It works great but you cannot see if it is getting to full without pulling it out. Small learning curve to judge when it is full! All in all very happy and I wold purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Debi1230

customer_reviews.title: Grills to perfection. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first indoor grill I have ever used. I wish I had bought one years ago! Absolutely love this grill! I use it at least 5 days a week. Easy to clean. I love that the trays easily pop out for cleaning. Top tray seems to be a bit hotter than bottom when using it in closed position, which is opposite of many of the reviews I read prior to purchasing. However it hasn't been an issue, I mostly grill chicken and the top seems a bit more seared than the bottom, but cooked perfect every time. My only regret is that I didn't buy this sooner. I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: bschill

customer_reviews.title: I Love Grilled Beaver!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beaver hunter; I use the entire body of what I kill, which means I eat beaver. I cannot have a traditional outdoor grill because of where I live, so I have spent considerable time researching and testing indoor grilling products. It was a long and sometimes painful journey to find that indoor grill capable of rendering me the perfect beaver steak, always pink in the middle with a light grill sear on the outside. The Cuisanart grill gets two thumbs up from me!
customer_reviews.author: Rye

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t brown as much as I like
customer_reviews.text: In my tight space I wanted something versatile and upon reading many reviews online I purchased this griddler. Cleaning is easy enough, cooking plates have a weight to them. I find I don’t get the “grill” marks on the pork or chicken though and I have to cook them more to get done. Lots of moisture released as they cook and not brown. Pancakes cook well. Am I totally happy with purchase? half and half.
customer_reviews.author: SunKissed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Love it would recommend all day long!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this!!! Fast grilled cheese, great breakfast croissant, perfect pancakes, nice grilled chicken, fast kabobs and very easy clean up. For the price IT ROCKS!!!!!!!! I do wish it came with waffle plates but I see I can add them oxox Con: It is a bit bulky, the outside gets so hot you will burn the $*#t out of your hand and it sits flat like pictured...my old one stood up like a suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: H. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: An excellent versatile unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Griddler. I love the unit and it is a staple in my kitchen. I primarily use it as a panini press and it does an excellent job. The plates come off easily and are dishwasher safe. It is a durable and well made and you will get years of use from it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! what a Griddler, it's so well thought out, easy cooking, easy cleanup and you server food like professional
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Wow! And I love it, my wife loves it, and my family completely enjoys it. It makes me cook like a professional from steaks to burgers, to Panini to enchiladas and with the Accessory Waffle Plates, Pancakes to Waffles are all a breeze. It opens up and becomes a full open grill or snaps into place for grilling panini bread sandwiches with a perfection of crunch and munch. You get what you pay for this item, it's so easy to cook and clean and the grease collection plates make messes a thing of the past. I would recommend to anyone looking for a great all around Griddler and waffle and pancake maker.
customer_reviews.author: amazon pro

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This product works great, but it is very unsafe. The power cords, is located behind the grill on the left. No matter how you cook, if there is more than on piece on the grill, the juices and grease run down the grill and get onto the power cord. So unsafe and bad design! Also, I notice how the plug gets so hot during use. It is made cheaply
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great smokeless indoor grill that works as good as the best outdoor grills'..
customer_reviews.text: This grill works great, actually I should say perfect'..On sear setting it grills just as good as any charcoal or outdoor gas grill. I used to really like the George Forman grills. Still do. I have several of them. I just like this Cuisinart a little better...Easy clean up and doesn't take a lot of space on the counter. Also, it does not make smoke when cooking like so many other indoor grills. Real decent product'. Highly recommend'..
customer_reviews.author: Real life Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I received this product on March 14th. I was able to use it 3 times without any problems. The 4th time it wouldn't stay hot long enough to grill the food. I was trying to cook chicken breast and it wouldn't even sear them. I tried it again over this past weekend with the same results. I only had 30 days to return the item but of course it didn't start malfunctioning until after that time period had passed. This is the worst purchase I've ever made on Amazon. I'm now looking for another indoor grill but will NOT be buying another Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy D Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: As a single woman living on her own, this is literally the most perfect product. I grill chicken on it almost every night (perfect size for one or two portions)- Not only does it heat up fast, but the food is cooked in less than 10 minutes. My favorite part though has to be how easy it is to clean. Once you let it cool down, scrap off the excess junk and wash with a sponge. I believe you can put it in the dishwasher as well if you wanted to. I have had it for about 3 months and not a problem yet. I highly suggest this product if you are cooking for 2 or less people.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We like making sandwiches on here and have also used it to grill veggies when it is rains on our patio plans. We got the waffle inserts as well, making it more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

product_meta.title: Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler, 13.5"(L) x 11.5"(W) x 7.12"(H), Silver With Silver/Black Dials
product_meta.description: With five separate cooking options, the Cuisinart Griddler can handle everything from pancakes and sausages to grilled cheese to steaks, hamburgers, and panini. A floating cover and one set of reversible plates turn the Griddler into a contact grill, panini press, full grill, full griddle, or half grill/half griddle. Dual temperature controls ensure everything is perfectly cooked every time on the removable dishwasher safe nonstick cooking plates for easy meals and clean up.
feature_bullets: 5-in-1 countertop unit works as a contact grill, panini press, full grill, full griddle and half grill/half griddle. Dimensions: 13.50 L x 11.50 W x 7.12 H inches
Brushed stainless-steel housing; sturdy panini-style handle; floating cover to adjust to thickness of food. BPA Free
Removable and reversible 11" x 9" dishwasher-safe nonstick cooking plates drain grease for healthy cooking into the integrated drip tray.
Adjustable temperature controls with indicator lights; gourmet recipes and scraping tool included
Please refer to the Product Video and the User Manual before use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars13,269 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
